IncidentSuppNarrative.NarrativeText: This incident was recorded using my Axon Digital body worn camera. Scene Processing: Seven (7) digital photographs were taken of the scene, and uploaded to Veri-Pic in accordance with Maryland State Police Policy procedures. Narrative: On September 19, 2023, at approximately 1528 hours, I TPR. Collins #7656 along with TFC. Kelly #6914, TFC. Backus #6648, and TPR. Barrientos #7396 of the Maryland State Police, responded to 2305 Grays Road, Prince Frederick, Calvert County, Maryland for a reported cardiac arrest. We arrived on scene at approximately 1536 hours and approached the side entrance of the residence. The complainant, later identified as Andrew Warren Hamilton II, W/M, 08/10/1945 opened the door to the residence and gestured for us to come inside. It should be noted Hamilton is the roommate of the deceased. As we made entry into the residence the complainant guided us through the residence to the rear right bedroom. Upon approach to the entrance to the bedroom the complainant positioned himself to the side of the entrance, and pointed into the bedroom explaining thats where the deceased victim is located. Hamilton advised he discovered the deceased approximately 15 minutes before our arrival. Upon my entry into the rear right bedroom I observed the victim, later identified as, Dallas Cline Palmer, Jr, W/M, 08/10/1945, sitting on the floor of the bedroom with his back against the bedside. He was wearing a red shirt with red shorts and was stiff and cold to the touch. I positioned Palmer on the floor so that he was lying flat on his back, and began CPR for approximately two minutes. At approximately 1541 hours, Ashley Windsor with Emergency Medical Services arrived on scene and pronounced Palmer deceased. Hamilton advised Palmer has been lethargic and not consuming his normal amounts of food. I observed a Ziploc bag of multiple prescription pill bottles in Palmers room. The Ziploc bag contained the following prescription medications: Tamsulosin HCL, Lisinopril, Triamterene-HCTZ, and Metoprolol Tartrate. I did not observe any signs of physical abuse or foul play. Maryland State Police Form 89B (Maryland State Police Death Investigation Report) was completed and forwarded to appropriate units. Palmers primary care doctor, Dr. Barth was contacted and advised he would sign off on the death certificate, therefore the forensic investigator did not respond to the scene. D. Palmers brother, who was later identified as Harald Lee Palmer, W/M, 10/27/1950 was notified of D. Palmers death by Hamilton prior to our arrival. H. Palmer requested that Sewell Funeral home be contacted to remove the deceased. Sewell Funeral Home was notified and responded to the scene to remove Dallas Cline Palmer Jr. Case Closed. All events occurred in Calvert County, Maryland.
